SEARCH
Package hms.boundary

Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
hms.boundary.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
A utility class that handles user input by interacting with the console. It provides methods to retrieve choices, strings, dates, and times from the user, with error handling for invalid input formats.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler()

  • Method Details

    • getChoice

      public static int getChoice(int low, int high) throws InvalidChoiceFormatException, InvalidChoiceValueException
      Receives an integer input from the user and ensures that the input is within a specified range. Throws an InvalidChoiceFormatException if the input format is incorrect, or an InvalidChoiceValueException if the input is outside the valid range.
      Parameters:
      low - The lower bound of the valid range.
      high - The upper bound of the valid range.
      Returns:
      The valid choice entered by the user.
      Throws:
      InvalidChoiceFormatException - if the input format is invalid.
      InvalidChoiceValueException - if the input choice is outside the valid range.

    • getString

      public static String getString()
      Receives a string from the user and returns the entered string.
      Returns:
      The string entered by the user.

    • getDate

      public static LocalDate getDate() throws InvalidDateException
      Receives a date input from the user and parses it into a LocalDate object. Throws an InvalidDateException if the input does not match the expected date format (yyyy-MM-dd).
      Returns:
      The parsed LocalDate object.
      Throws:
      InvalidDateException - if the input date format is invalid.

    • getTime

      public static LocalTime getTime() throws InvalidTimeException
      Receives a time input from the user and parses it into a LocalTime object. Throws an InvalidTimeException if the input does not match the expected time format (HH:mm:ss).
      Returns:
      The parsed LocalTime object.
      Throws:
      InvalidTimeException - if the input time format is invalid.
